author: snapped2002
comment: The only complaint is that I can't track my medications taken like I can my blood. That would be great to make sure that I didn't miss my pills. Keep up the great work. . Aug 6 I am now using this to track my foods and blood pressure as well.  . I can't even describe how much this is going to help me when it comes to tracking and reporting to my doctor. . I give it 6 out of 5 stars!

author: androidkhh
comment: This is a very good little app with some serious disadvantages. It is very easy to use, but the export of data only works for the sugar level. So, while you can enter and check blood pressure for example, you cannot print it it and show it to your doctor. Also there is no export to CSV file or something like that. With a little more effort this could become a truly great app.

author: Bob Steele
comment: Been using for a couple of weeks and fairly impressed. Let's me add sugar levels when needed but I do sometimes have to go back and edit auto cooments like "after lunch" as it must assume I eat at same time every day. Will keep using though as it seems a useful and easy to use app. Edit:when rating app, was asked if it had a "leader board"? Wouldn't that be fun? I'll raise you my best 18.8mmol/l 😁

author: RIchard Scarlett
comment: As a newly diagnosed diabetic I really needed some place to write things down in a way that made sense this app covers everything. You input your sugar levels there is a place for you to put your food intake there is a tab for medication and even a tab for your blood pressure. This app works really well for me.

author: Iris Blake
comment: Very simple to use and see trends for blood sugar. The only thing I don't like if you have to enter exactly how much food you ate.  There isn't just a journal aspect to food recording. Also I would love for this to sync with my fitness app!

Had this app on my old phone. Had trouble syncing/transferring my old data across. Paying for monthly subscription. Reached out to support. No response after 1 month despite 2 tickets and numerous emails being sent. Great app, disappointing service. If they bother to contact me ill update my rating.

author: Jerry Lee
comment: As far as a tracker it is little more than a miniature spreadsheet. It has a nice interface and is intuitive. I like using it instead of excel. (Why reinvent the wheel unless you add custom mags) It would be much better if it integrated with fitbit and other apps. Interfaces with other hardware would be a step up as well. ie Bluetooth scales, etc. (Wouldn't need to develop those if they just shared data with something that already had them, like fitbit.)

author: Fred Servito
comment: I tested out several diabetes apps when I first got diagnosed with adult onset Type 2. With the other apps, there were annoying ads. I also like the simplicity and the interface for this app. I am paying the $1 a month to share my data with other devices. For me, this is the best diabetes app.

author: Jazmin Oviedo
comment: Allows you to detail anything needed. For example, today felt very thirsty getting a saline serum, so checked BSs: 46.       Lollipop immediately! 😋😋😋 Tag it here right away. Handy, big time. Makes your life easier...

author: Kenny Springs
comment: This is by far the best diabetic log app that I have tried.  I've downloaded and tried many, but was sorely disappointed.  This app gives me everything I need in one place.  I can log my sugar levels and my blood pressure, not to mention my medications.  I highly recommend this app to anyone who needs a diabetes tracker.

author: Marla James
comment: I am diabetic and have high blood pressure. This app helps me remember to do the tests. Being able to see in graph form helps me maintain  a healthy  blood sugar . Also this is an app I bring to my doctor so she can see the numbers. I would highly recommend this app. Thank you whomever wrote it.

author: b h
comment: Excellent app.  I would rate it 4.5 if that was an option.   Only negative is a minor one: your recent update made it impossible to enter food in the Blood Sugar section without typing in a # (I use a '1'); I enter my food in the 'Notes' line when I eat, then enter my BS readings a couple hours later.  That said, I  send my BS & BP readings to my doctor  (though that format could be made easier - I have to print & scan the charts).

author: Terry M
comment: Unfortunately I am getting a parse error when trying to enter my medication. Since I am on a weekly prescription, I thought this would be a great tool for tracking. I love the blood glucose part of the app though. The medication tracker works on my phone but not tablet. Plz fix.

author: Pizzaman Hall
comment: Perfect!! Just what i needed!! It could use a few more touch ups....some spacing or lines is needed in the export & the sugar log. It looks like everything is bunched together especially when the notes are added. I love the weight & blood pressure part too!

author: Bailee Graves
comment: I've had diabetes for 15 years. I've tried several different apps but this one is by far the best. It allows me to track only what I feel is necessary. I especially love how it has separate pages for the info I'm tracking. Makes it easy to follow. I would highly recommend this app!

author: Robin D
comment: This application has proven to be very useful in respect to keeping a record of my blood sugar levels. I like the graph and how easy it is to use. My only issue is that it sometimes/rarely doesn't "hold" what I type in, so I have to retype it.

author: James Warren
comment: It works very well for tracking daily readings. Unfortunately,  I needed to get a new phone and attempted to transfer my info...it did not work. I was unable to save and/or transfer to my new phone.  So I lost more than four months worth of readings.

author: Steve Dayton
comment: Nice app. Easy to use. Only two fixes. 1. The + button at the bottom right of the Blood Sugar section covers up part of the last item in the list. 2. The top number at the left of the graph in the Statistics section is mostly cut off so it is unreadable.

author: Gabriela Kandziora
comment: I highly recommend this app. I found it to be the best glucose monitor with blood pressure I could find. I do wish that it allowed me a space for my weight, my activity for the day, and the amount of water I drink throughout the day. I am sure they will add these things. I highly recommend this app.

author: James T
comment: It's good but the app needs more than one way to back up. I need to convert tracks into Word or Excel so I can print it out and show to doctor. I dislike Google Drive.

author: nyconsult410
comment: Just being diagnosed with diabetes can be intimidating, having to track blood sugars and medications can be trying, it is apps like this one that helps lift some of that burden. Thanks for this excellent and helpful app! It has helped make this transition easier!

author: Julia Dendinger
comment: Easy to input my blood glucose numbers. I like that it plots them in a graph. Really shows the highs, lies and slip ups. You can make notes on readings that are abnormal so you can track why your levels spiked up or dropped.

author: Bill Smith
comment: Very happy with the app to track my blood sugar results. I like the graphing of the numbers which gives me a quick look at how I am doing with my management. The only thing I would add to the graphing would be a colored band that depicts your overall settings for your high and low goals. Great app, thank you very much!

author: Michael Richard
comment: I was using glucose buddy, until they did an update, and it all became confusing. Plus the ads!! They just wanted you to upgrade to premium, and pay! This app is simple to use, and they're not always pushing ads on you everytime you use it.

Needs to allow people in Food area save even when don't know what carbs, calories or grams on meals. Sometimes when eat out we don't know until later on. Some people like to write immediately their meals that way won't forget anything.

author: Jeanne Hale
comment: I wasn't sure exactly what to expect, but have been pleased to date.  It's very easy to use and makes straight forward list that are easy to share.  It has a simple graph that it automatically configures for you.  The breakdown of the catagories are easily emailed to your medical provider without a lot extra unneeded things.  I have recommended it to friends.

author: Sally Salberg
comment: I have been using this app for quite a while when all of the sudden the color coding for each days reading turned from green (GOOD glucose level) and red (BAD glucose level) to plain BLACK.  I figured something happened to the app to remove the meaningful color coding and requested the developer to please fix it.  They asked me for more info so they could help with this problem. I sent them screenshots of the problem on my phone and they wrote back telling me how my settings must have gotten changed and advised me how to correct them. I followed their instructions and all color coding returned.  Thanks for the help.

author: Chris Lincoln
comment: Really clean interface for capturing glucose readings. If I could change 1 thing, I would have it auto-focus on the sugar concentration field to save me a tap.

One of the best diabetes log apps! It could be even better though - FEATURE REQUEST: Add Google Fit integration to the app, snooze option to reminder notifications, and Android Oreo app icon shortcuts. Please. This is one of, if not the best diabetes log apps out there, I want to see this app stay fresh and modern.
The app is great! I'm a 13-year-long type 1 diabetic, and I find the app to be just what I was looking for to track the record of my diabetes statistics such as blood glucose and A1C.

author: IBEWelectronut
comment: Love the way it tracks my blood-sugar levels and shows me my stats. I would give this app 5 stars but the stupid reminders, that I deleted, keep popping up on my phone. Please fix this.

author: Amador Delerme
comment: With this app you can track your glucose, blood pressure, medications and meals. Also has a graph that shows if your progress is good or bad. It would be nice if they add one for the blood pressure. Overall, Highly recommended!

author: Dawn Newman
comment: I love it. I'm just recently diagnosed a diabetic. This app helps track my glucose levels and at the same time let's me know if I'm doing ok or not. Right at that moment. I used to think "well, that number is ok". But I now know that it isn't. So I know when and what to change so that I'm doing better. This app also let's me track my A1C. I couldn't do that on my other app. Plus an added perk, I can monitor my food intake. I couldn't do that before either. Now I can look at my diet and micro manage it. And that's not all. And there are other great uses. I guess what I'm really saying is I love this app

author: L. Nick
comment: Started using this app on 4/7; My first day of insulin. The stress of an out of the blue diagnosis was made easier with not having to try a bunch of apps. I installed this app and it was one and done!! Keep up the good work!

author: Lorraine Moore
comment: Been using the app for 7 days now to help manage gestational diabetes. I like how the graph tracks readings but can't seem to export the graph or averages. Is there a way around this? It would be brilliant to have on paper at clinic appointments.

author: Kevin Buzuleciu
comment: I like this app it is user friendly and has all the averages right when you open it up. Best one I have found, there are a few minor things but no adds!!!

author: Brian Surratt
comment: Only the features you need to capture metrics and review them.  No small, marginal features that get in your way.  And following Google's modern design for Android apps.  Great app.

author: Jason Lucas
comment: I got tired of forgetting my meter and logbook. So now I have a meter at work and home with this app as my central log book that is always with me. I can print reports to share with my doctor. Love it.

author: mark n kate B
comment: Just diagnosed helps me to work out what spikes the sugars.. graphing is a bit slow to zoom

author: Usman Khan
comment: It's good to give u graphical view of ur blood suger levels but 8 can't see the value on the peeks and lows, only values on the axis is not enough coz it doesn't give u the exact number. Please add values on the peeks and lows and it would be great tool. Thanks
